Consider the linear programming problem for the profit maximization (Rs) of a manufacturer with the objective function as,
\(
\begin{array}{l}
Z_{\max }=2000 x+3000 y \text { subjected to } \\
3 x+2 y \leq 90 \\
x+2 y \leq 100, x \geq 0, y \geq 0
\end{array}
\)
The manufacturer can make a maximum profit of Rs?

Consider a linear programming problem with two variables and two constraints. The objective function is: Maximize \(x_1+x_2\). The corner points of the feasible region are \((0\), \(0)(0,2)(2,0)\) and \((\frac{4 }{ 3},\frac{4 }{ 3})\). If an additional constraint \(x_1+x_2 \leq 5\) is added, the optimal solution occurs at the point.
